intro: Hesperis obtusa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved scabious, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, blooming from late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and grasslands.
